name: Overview
data: [{"id":"22c39cc3-b2e4-4804-887f-56d8c8c174ae","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Documentation: Scope & Namespace Management","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"99a7b3bd-434c-49ed-894f-b21a7792c2a2","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This group encompasses the foundational methods responsible for the lifecycle and identity of a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". In static analysis, maintaining a clear \"sense of place\" is critical; these methods ensure that every scope knows where it resides in the program hierarchy and how to identify itself to other components of the analyzer.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"27439387-324a-41d7-80e5-284a0b864bf1","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Introduction","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2cf2e1eb-9bb3-4b75-be80-d521c438e943","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Scope & Namespace Management","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" group serves as the skeletal structure of the scope. Before definitions can be added or counters incremented, a scope must be correctly situated within the global program tree. This group handles the initialization of storage containers (for definitions and parameters) and manages the \"Fully Qualified Namespace\" (FQNS)—a unique string path that distinguishes, for example, a variable named ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Module A","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" from a variable named ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Module B","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7c3bde96-11f7-484a-9ed9-8c6c71a7fea1","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How It Works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c9f70747-43fc-41ee-a234-ee49fcca895c","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"These methods operate by establishing a hierarchical link between ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" instances.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"23788111-f9af-4163-803e-925292909ad3","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Initialization:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" When a new scope is created (e.g., when the analyzer enters a new function), it captures a reference to its ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"parent","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This allows the analyzer to perform \"upward lookups,\" mimicking how Python searches for global variables from within a local function.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8b5f6d1a-ea11-4459-a1a7-1b874dad9f72","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Identity:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"fullns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" attribute acts as a unique URI for the scope. By retrieving this via ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_ns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", other modules in the Jarvis framework can accurately link data-flow facts to specific code regions.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"dfb1888f-0073-44c3-a489-8126b911b2bd","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Visibility:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Through the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__str__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method, the scope can serialize its current state—including its parameters and their resolved values—into a readable format, which is essential for tracing how the analyzer interpreted specific execution paths.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8f8b2734-15b5-4461-ab93-e8c852babd22","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Reasoning","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bf5ce6cb-4de3-4a99-85e4-e2af624b7b3e","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Structural Integrity:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" By enforcing that parents must be ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" instances during initialization, the system prevents disconnected \"orphaned\" scopes which would break the variable lookup chain.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"fc6e4b79-7bc1-410a-9e95-175ac64435f5","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Uniqueness:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Using string-based namespaces ensures that even anonymous or dynamically generated blocks have a predictable, stable identifier during the analysis pass.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a9103f98-c16c-40a7-abf5-08b20eedf04c","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Debugging Transparency:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" The inclusion of complex string representation logic (including parameter points-to values) allows developers to verify the internal state of the analyzer at a glance, ensuring that the simulated execution matches expected Python behavior.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c0b8243f-70e2-4b10-b75d-1efe189c577c","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"c79b7856-5beb-4e46-9ca9-88de70b3fc24","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Method up the scope's internal dictionary for ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"defs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", initializes all synthetic name counters to zero, and validates the parent scope relationship to maintain the tree hierarchy.","styles":{}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}}]},{"cells":[{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_ns","styles":{"code":true}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Provides the absolute namespace string (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pkg.module.Class.method","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), used as a primary key for indexing scopes across the entire project analysis.","styles":{}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}}]},{"cells":[{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"__str__","styles":{"code":true}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}},{"type":"tableCell","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Generates a detailed diagnostic string. It maps each parameter to its last known \"points-to\" value, providing a snapshot of the scope's input state at the time of call.","styles":{}}],"props":{"colspan":1,"rowspan":1,"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"}}]}]},"children":[]},{"id":"b14fc462-a0ea-4fc9-a292-e66621ee2394","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
